description: LIDA MOSER

title: City Property. Tax Called Racist By Community Service Society
description: One of New York City's major civic organizations, the 130-year-old Community Service Society, charged yesterday that the city's realproperty tax racist in the way it has evolved.

title: The Rescue (Maybe) of New York City
description: President Carter has committed his Administration to a New York City financing plan with longterm guarantees. This is a major conceptual breakthrough and represents a fundamental change in Federal policy since the beginning of the city crisis in 1975.

title: Taxpayers Resent PublicJob Costs
description: In Detroit, the head of the auto workers uruion complains that some public employees want too much.

title: Philip Habib Will Resign No. 3 Post at State &pt. Because of Heart Ailment
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Philip C. Habib, the Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, is expected to resign for health reasons from his thirdranking post in the department next week, Administration officials reported today.

title: Lightweight, Loose and Easy to Wear
description: This spring, look for light fabrics that float on the body for maximum comfort, oversize shirts and jackets for ease, tapered pants for a lean, longlegged look, sandals with graceful high heels. For AnneMarie Schiro's full report on the fashion scene, see Page 3.

title: Robert Harris Kramer Marries Lois M. Paley
description: Lois Michele Paley and Robert Harris Kramer were married yesterday afternoon in Temple Beth Am in Merrick, L. I. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Sanford E. Saperstein.

title: Marian Hahn on Piano
description: ONE of the most precious gifts a musician can have is a natural affinity for the instrument of his or her choice, an ease of articulation that seems inborn rather than acquired. Marian Hahn conveyed this impression at her piano recital Saturday afternoon at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Hawks 101, Sonics 94
description: ATLANTA, March 5 (AP)Charlie Criss, who at 5 feet 8 inches is the smallest player in the N.B.A., scored 16 points to help the Atlanta Hawksgain a 10194 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics today. Atlanta was trailing by 90S5 when Criss scored points and Tom McMillan and Armon Hill each got a basket as the Hawks rallied for 10 consecutive points.

title: Aboard Carrier Lexington, 35 Years Later
description: Dawn over the South Pacific. On the flight deck of the American aircraft carrier Lexington, about 60 Grumman Hellcat fighter planes are manned and ready. The air officer's voice bellows through the bullhorn.

title: Nets Turn ack Braves, 109103
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., March 5 (AP) John Williamson scored 38 points and Bernard King had 26 to lead the New Jersey Nets to a 109103 victory over the Buffalo Braves in a National Basketball Association game today.

title: MINERS REJECT CONTRACT, 2 TO 1; CARTER TO ANNOUNCE PLAN TODAY FOR COMPELLING RETURN TO WORK
description: WASHINGTON, March 5In the 90th day of their walkout, the rank and file of the United Mine Workers today rejected by more than 2 to I the proposed strike settlement urged upon them by President Carter and their own leaders. Arnold R. Miller, the union president, told reporters by telephone tonight: I've peen keeping track of the voting and There is no doubt that the contract has been defeated. I've got to think about what's the next move and try to get back Lo the bargaining table if I can.

title: True Story of City Gang Life No Glittery West Side Story
description: JoAnn and Nellie Vega look forward to the day they can once again see each other. But for now, the two sisters are at wartorn apart by their love for two members of rival Brooklyn gangs.

title: WILLIAM T, LUSK DIES, EXHEAD OF TIFFANY
description: William T, Lusk, a leading expert on gems and former president of Tiffany & Company, died yesterday at the Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived in New Canaan, Conn.

title: Few on 3 Death Rows Are There for Killing Blacks
description: ATLANTA, Mrch 5Preliminary results of a new study of the race of Death Row inmates and the race of their victims in three Southern states show that few blacks, and no whites, have been ordered executed for the killing of blacks.

title: Soviet Crime Problem Tied To City Life and Social Ills
description: MOSCOW, March 5At the age of 14, Aleksandr Mikhailov dropped out of school and began to hang around the streets and staircases of his neighborhood in Gorky, an industrial city 250 miles east of here. He had no job, and almost no relationOutside Moscow's Law Crime in the Soviet Union Second of Two Articles ship with his parents; they receded into the backgrcund of his world. The most important figure for him became another boy who taught him how to rob kiosks and streetcar coin boxes and stores. The money went for liquor.

title: Commodities
description: Although trading volume in foreign currency futures is rising, the market remains speculative on the periphery of bankdominated dealings in foreign currencies. Page D5.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: IT'S HARD TO TELL exactly what James Wooten is up to in Dasher: The Roots and the Rising of Jimmy Carter. Sometimes, it looks as if Mr. Wooten, a White House ???nnapnt of The New York Times.

title: Track: Villanova Outruns IC4A Field
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 5Frank Costello, the Maryland coach, called it picture perfect, but awesome may have been the most appropriate description of Villanova's victory today in the 57th annual IC4A indoor track and field championships.

title: Study for Banks Finds Tax Rule On BadDebt Cushion Too Strict
description: A significant cost of doing business faced by all commercial bankssetting up reserves for bad debtsshould be liberalized for Federal taxreporting purposes, according to a trade group's study, released here yesterday.

title: Rockefeller Sharing Art
description: NELSON A. ROCKEFELLER said yesterday that he was out of politics and was embarking on a new venturemaking his extensive art collection available to the public via publishing and fine reproduct ions.

title: Tongsun Park Says He Gave a Rice Miller $80,000
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Tongsun Park as told Federal investigators that he paid a politically prominent Louisiana rice miller $80,000 to deflect rice from the domestic market for sale to South Korea so as to maintain his position as the key agent for the Korean Government, according to transcripts of his interrogation in Seoul.

title: Chess:
description: BOGOJNO, YugoslaviaThe world champion, Anatoly Karpov, is grinding his way through the Bogojno International Tournament end game by end game. He holds the lead with 21/21/2, having saueezed out endings against Bent Larsen of Denmark and Anthony Miles of England and having gingerly hung on for a draw in his pawndown ending with Borislav Ivkov of Yugoslavia.

title: Concertgoers Surround Stage
description: DENVER, March 5It was in 1971 that this city in the Rockies set out to build a new concert hall, and was going to show those traditionbound Easterners a thing or two. Nothing so conventional as a long auditorium with a stage at the end for Denver instead, this city opted for an arenalike hall with the orchestra in the middle and 2,750 seats arrayed around it on all sides.

title: N.C.A.A., N.I.T. Set Playoff Teams
description: Marquette, the defending National Collegiate champion; Indiana, the 1976 champion; Syracuse, Providence, Notre Dame, North Carolina and Arkansas were among the 11 atlarge teams selected yesterday to play in the 40th annual National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament beginning next weekend.

title: Sports World Specials
description: Springtime in New York without Angel Cordero? That's right, except for some major stakes races.

title: Ethiopia Reports Recapture of Key Ogaden Town
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 5Ethiopia said today that its forces had recaptured the strategic town of Jijiga in a major battle against the Somalis in the Ogaden region.

title: Atlanta Saves Its Fabulous Fox
description: ATLANTA; March 5The Fox, perhaps the South's greatest movie theater, a popcorn palace of gargantuan gaudiness, has been saved from the wrecker's ball that for more than three years threatened its mighty silver screen and its imposing battlements minarets and onion domes.

title: Outdoors
description: OAK BEACH, L.I. IZAAK Walton, the contemplative angler, would probably have not spent much time on party boats if they had existed in his time. Neither will anyone who regards fishing as essentially a solitary endeavor.

title: Sports Briefs
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 5 (AP)Debbie Austin, an American golfer, shot a finalround 73 today and wcn the Australian women's championship by 10 strokes. Miss Austin's rounds of 70, 70 and 73 gave her a 213 total and earnedfor her about $4,000.

title: Begin Said to Urge New Peace Talks In Letter for Sadat
description: TEL AVIV, March 5Prime Minister Menacbem Begin sent a secret message to President Anwar elSadat of Egypt through American diplomatic channels today, reportedly urging resumption of direct negotiations between their two nations.

title: TAFTHARTLEY ACTION CALLED LIKELY CHOICE
description: WASHINGTON, March 5President Carter will announce tomorrow his choice of a Government action to reopen the coal mines, Administration officials said today, adding that the most likely choice would be invocation of the TaftHartley Act.

title: Deaths
description: ADELSBERGHyman, beloved husband and brother, devoted father and loving grandfather. Passed away Saturday, March 4. He is survived by his wife Toni, his daughters Gloria Strauss and Dorothy Leeds Weinstock, his sister Tillie Kershner and his brother Morris. No services, The family requests that in lieu of flowers, donations be sent to the Heart Fund.

title: Soccer: Cosmos Top Bermuda, 41
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, March 5Playing before oneeighth of this island's population, the Cosmos displayed their soccer skills today and defeated Bermuda's national team. 41.

title: Ski Touring By Helicopter
description: SUN VALLEY, IDAHO THE sleek white helicopter with the red and yellow trim lifted gently off the valley floor and soared up among the snowcovered peaks of the Sawtooth Mountain Range. Below, a family of largehorned elk stared upward. Two circling eagles flew off to the east. After an 11minute flight, the chopper set down in a whirling cloud of snow at 9,700 feet.

title: Begin Said to Urge New Peace Talks In Letter for Sadat
description: TEL AVIV, March 5Prime Minister Menachem Begin sent a secret message to President Anwar elSada t of Egypt through American diplomatic channels today, reportedly urging resumption of direct negotiations between their two nations.

title: Where to Go, What's Provided
description: Sun Valley is in southcentral Idaho, 78 miles north of Twin Falls and 12 miles from the small airport at Halley, Idaho. Most airlines route the trio through Salt Lake City. The Nordic Ski School and Touring Center is near the Sun Valley Inn. Address: Box 272, Sun Valley, Idaho 83353. Telephone: (208) 6224111, extension 2250. The director's name is Leif Odmark.

title: Supplementary OvertheCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds, prepared by 1the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Cleveland's Winter May Be Grim
description: CLEVELAND, March 5 To say that Cleveland has had a hard winter would be an understatement, In addition to the worst snowstorms in 100 years, blackouts and the inability of public services to cope with it all, Clevelanders have been bombarded daily with other bad news: corruption in the city govennment, fiscal deficits, public employee strikes, gangland killings and a Court order that the debtridden school board must bus twice as many students as Boston between the black and white neighborhoods.

title: Nkomo Reported Ready to Ask For Cuban Help in Rhodesia War
description: Joshua Nkomo, one of the major Rho= desian guerrilla. leaders, says he will probably have to ask Cuba to send troops to help in the guerrilla war against the white minority government, according to an interview in Newsweek that was published yesterday.

title: 76ers 102, Suns 92
description: PHOENIX, March 5 (AP)Doug Collins scored 20 points, including 8 in the fourth quarter, to lead the Philadelphia 76ers to a 10292 triumph over the Phoenix Suns today. The game was interrupted in the third quarter when a 4 by 4 section of the ceiling fell on the floor. The ceiling had been weakened by the heavy rains in Phoenix.

title: London Vote Shows Power of Racial Issue
description: LONDON, March 5For 30 years, economic issues have dominated Britain's general election campaigns as the country struggled to establish a realistic postwar role for itself.

title: Maln'utrition Taking Bigger Toll Among Mexican Children
description: MEXICO CITY, March 5In the Cerro del Judio slum overlooking the capital, Rbsario Salinas prepared her children's lunch of beans and lentils. The last time we had meat was on Christmas Eve, she related. Before that, who knows? We eat what we can buy.

title: Some Refuse to Abandon Hope They Find in Harlem
description: Elaine Marius was born in Harlem, went to school in Harlem and works in Harlem. Although many of her childhood friends have left the community, Mrs. Marius, who could afford to live almost anywhere in the city, has stayed behind because, she said, Harlem is where my roots are.

title: Panama's Political. Palindrome
description: WASHINGTON A man, a plan, a canal  Panama!

title: Russian Sect Runs Afoul Of Oregon Truancy Statute
description: WOODBURN, Ore., March 2 A 31yearold immigrant woman, who speaks only Russian, faces a possible jail sentence here because of her daughter's failure to attend School.

title: Around the Nation
description: BOSTON, March 5 (AP) Mother's milk appears to give some protection to infants against congenital hypothyroidism, a disease that in its extreme form known as cretinism, doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital said in a report released today.

title: The Area's Badminton Clubs
description: The member clubs of the Metropolitan Badminton Association are listed here in alphabetical order. Club contacts should be checked for further information and for verification of nights and flours of play.

title: Advertising
description: Frederick M. Iseman, 25 years old and two years out of Yale, is looking for $2 million to start a magazine. Judging by his track record, he'll find it.

title: Mandel, 5 Others Ask Reversal
description: BALTIMORE, March 5 (AP)Suspended Gov. Marvin Mandel and his five codefendants, contending that the Government overstepped its bounds in their trial on charges of mail fraud and racketeering, have asked an appeals court to reverse their convictions.

title: Schubert Lieder By Ameling
description: ELLY AMBLING was playing to her strength yesterday afternoon at Alice Tully Hall. Not that she isn't noted for her mastery of a wide range of the song literature. But Schubert is at the core of that literature, and as probably our finest living lieder singer, Miss Ameling delivered a recital to cherish.

title: Blacks and Politics: Steady Gain In a Decade of Disappointment
description: Ten years after the Kerner commission issued its report, forecasting the development of two societies, one black, one whiteseparate and unequal, there is much disappointment and some disillusionment in America's black community. But the picture is not entirely bleak.

title: Janet Guthrie Talks Of Being a Pioneer
description: IT has been two years since Janet Guthrie announced that she would try to qualify for the Indianapolis 500. Mechanical problems subsequently plagned her 1976 effort, but last May 22 she became the first woman to gain the Indy field, recording a qualifying speed of 188.404 miles an hour. A broken valve seat caused her to drop out of the race early.

title: Snorts Guide
description: For the first time since the International Tennis Hall of Fame was established in 1954 at Newport, R. I., a substantial part of its collection will be brought to New York. The exhibit will be part of the Park Avenue Antiques Fair, through Sunday at the Seventh Regiment Armory, Park Avenue and 67th Street. It will include tennis clothing from the 1880's to the present. historic trophies, antique racquets an films of Bill Tilden and other stars of the 1920's. On Sunday, Robert S. Day, director of the Hall of Fame, will present a film and discuss the history of tennis. The hours through Saturday are from 12:30 P.M. to 9:30 P.M., and on Sunday trom 12:30 to 6. Admission costs $3.50.

title: BEATRICE FOODS BIDS $488 MILLION IN CASH, STOCK FOR TROPICANA
description: The Beatrice Food Company has concluded a tentative agreement to purchase Tropicana Products Inc., for about $488 million in cash and stock, the two companies disclosed yesterday.

title: ANDERSON PROPOSES TAXCUTTING PLAN
description: Charging that Governor Carey's tax reduction program was gimmicked up for a oneshot political advantage, the leadership of the Republicancontrolled State Senate yesterday released its own proposal, with business tax cuts almost identical to Mr. Carey's, but with permanent personalincometax reductions aimed more heavily at upperincome taxpayers.

title: Badminton A Fast Sport For Tough Birds
description: IN Indonesia, they're national heroesmobbed, headlined, adulated. In China, they are closely guarded, concealed from the rest of the world. In England, they are trained from early childhood, in remote villages. outlying hamlets.

title: U.S. Mexico Prisoner Exchange Set
description: HOUSTON, March 5 (UPI)  Twelve Mexican citizens are scheduled to fly to their homeland tomorrow in another exchange of prisoners between the United States and Mexico. The prisoners appeared before a Federal magistrate last week and were advised of their rights. They chose the transfer program. An unknown number of American prisoners will be picked up in Mexico City and Hermosillo and returned to San Diego.

title: Princess Grace on Stage
description: WASHINGTON FOR HER RETURN to the American stage, Her Serene Highness, Princess Grace of Monaco, the former Grace Kelly of Philadelphia and Hollywood, has chosen to appear with Richard Pasco, a leading actor with the Royal Shakespeare Company, in an ecological evening of poetry entitled Birds, Beasts and Flowers. On tour of the United States, the two performed Friday night at the Hartke Theater at Catholic University.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Tsar's Bride Overture, RimskyKorsakov; Sleigh Ride, Delius; Variations on a Theme by Ronini, Chopin; Motet, Vasilissa, Argo Gaude, Dufay.

title: Jan Merrill Sets World 3,000 Mark
description: MONTREAL, March 5 (AP)Jan Merrill of Waterford, Conn., set a world record at the Canadian indoor track and field championships today when she was timed in 8 minutes 57.6 seconds in the women's 3,000meter race. Miss Merrill's was the only world standard set during the weekend competition at the Claude Robillard Center. Her time bettered the mark of 9:02.54, set by Francie Larrieu in 1974.

title: A Latvian's Tent Diplomacy Gets Mother Back
description: Last year, Igor Dmitrowsky got tax refund of a few hundred dollars, enough to suit his.design. Ha quit his job and bought a pup tent, a sleeping bag, a chair and some writing materials. He fashioned a large, crisply letfered placard that said: Soviet Union Let My Mother Go!
