description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Bruce Irons of Tryon, N.C., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Victoria Irons, to Timothy George Welch, son of Mrs. Francis Henry De Schryver of Glen Ellyn, Ill., and the late George Louis Welch.

title: Leading French Popular Singer, Claude Francois, in Home Mishap
description: PARIS, March 11 (UPI)  Claude Francois, a leading popular singer in France for the last 18 years, was electrocuted today in his Paris home, the police said.

title: A Long Island Wholesaler Stocks a World of Cheeses
description: It seems that suddenly there is a cheese shop on every corner. Fine imported cheeses that a few years ago were available only on a very limited basis in handful of stores on Long Island have become regular inventory. Even the supermarket chains boast wellstocked cheese departments.

title: Sports Psychologists and the Soviet Athlete
description: Gregory Raiport's article (The Sports Psychologist Gives Russians an Edge, Feb. 19) may inspire critics of our amateur and Olympic sports programs to new heights. The Russians have sports psychologists to improve athletic performance. We do not. There is fear the Russians will rout us in the 1980 Olympic Games in Moscow.

title: The Voice Of America
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, March 11In the struggle over the Middle East, Washington's official overseas radio service, the Voice of America, is in the center of a ceaseless propaganda battle. And since its work is now under review and even attack by some members of Congress, a report from the field may be in order.

title: Bar Upholds Lawyer Who Withheld Knowledge of Client's Prior Crimes
description: More than four years ago, a Syracuse mechanic charged with a homicide told his lawyer that he had killed two other people as well. The lawyer discovered the bodies and photographed them.

title: Gymnastics. Champion Eliminated
description: Thousands of people paid up to $12 a seat and $2 for a program and still did not know who the competitors were as the American Cup gymnastics tournament began a twoday run yesterday.

title: The Impertinent Question Mark
description: The idea that American Jews areor should beunited on the very issues that now. divide Israel's Parliament and Prime Minister Begin's Cabinet is, plainly, preposterous, Yet some leaders of the Jewish community are not only pretending to such unity on the eve of Mr. Begin's visit to Washington; they also seek to promote it by hunting for villains in President Carter's court. It an unworthy, dangerous diversion from the serious, questions that need to be faced in the Middle East and that, happily, are being faced by the Istaelis themselves.

title: Susan Fierrnan Will Be Wed
description: The engagement of Susan Fierman to Andrew R. Taussig has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Morton S. Fierman of Cheltenham, Pa., parents of the future bride. Mr. Taussig is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph J. Taussig of Elkins Park, Pa.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: Of course, this is not the sign of healthy person, but you only have to take a look at the way people keep their houses up or down to measure the amount of selfrespect inside. Or so would seem.

title: Tests for 2 in Soviet Space Station
description: MOSCOW, March 11 (AP)The two Soviet astronauts aboard the Saut 6 space station, Yuri Romanenko and Georgi Grechko, today underwent detailed medical tests designed to help evaluate the effects of extended orbital flight on the human body, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported. It was their 92d day in orbit.

title: Edwin Yeo 3d, Banker, Fiance Of Miss Greene
description: Mergaret Lyford Greene, a vice president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York in its foreign exchange operations, plans to be married in September to Edwin Harley Yeo 3d, chair- man of the First National Bank o Chicago's asset and liability management committee and former Under Secretary of the Treasury for monetary affairs.

title: Topics
description: Imprisoning someone for a year at the Rikers Island municipal jail costs three times as much as a year Harvard or Yale. So reports a recent study of New York City jail costs conducted by the National Council on Crime and Delinquency. The council concluded that,

title: Ideas &
description: Less than a month ago, three wellknown geneticists estimated that about a third of genetically caused retardation could be prevented by wider use of known techniques. Last week, amid growing pressure against the March of Dimes by the National Right to Life Committee and its allies, it was disclosed that the March of Dimes intends to phase out its support of genetic services programs. Included are programs to detect chromosomal abnormalities in prospective parents and defects in unborn babies. Nearly all such services in the United States now depend on March of Dimes support.

title: Martha Seijas Fiancee Of Paul Francis Hayden
description: Dr, and Mrs. Pedro Seijas of Valencia, Venezuela, formerly of Lima, Peru, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Martha Elena Seijas, to Paul Francis Hayden, son of Mr. and

title: Morgado, Carey Secretary, Called Chief of Staff in Administration
description: Last summer, when Governor Carey promoted Robert J. Morgado to secretary, many onlookers wondered whether Mr. Carey wasn't making a mistake by thrusting a bright 34-year-old techniIcian into perhaps the most sensitive post in state government.

title: An IslandHopping Tour of the Casual Turks and Caicos
description: Al the south end of the , Bahamas chain, east of Cuba and north of Haiti, a crescent of tiny flat islands seems to float on the ocean. The Turks and Cakos, as they are called, consist of eight main islands and perhaps 30 smaller ones called cays. In all, they stretch 150 miles. Not one rises more than a few feet above sea level; they look as if they have just barely drifted upabove the water.

title: New York Pair First inBridge At Title Event
description: HOUSTON, March 11One of New YOrk's topranked stars seemed headed for a major success at the American Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals here today.

title: Middlesex Getting A Satellite Hospital
description: PERTH AMBOY WHAT does a large hospital do when many of its patients live a good distance away? Just like a bank or stock brokerage firm, it builds a branch.

title: Victims Disclose Travel Swindles Before State Panel
description: A realestate broker from Rochester told last week how he and his wife last summer paid $1,400 for tickets and accOmmodations for a longplanned vacation trip to Hawaii that never materialized.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: WHEN our social workers first reported back to us about their visit to Rahway State Prison in New Jersey with a group of Abbott House adnles- cents, the board's reaction was positive. Some of us had seen the television presentation of the Juvenile Awareness Project by the Rahway lifers.

title: Votes in Congress
description: I. Vote on motion to shelve amendment to provide that the neutrality provided for in the proposed Panama Canal treaty shall not be construed as permitting warships of nations with whom the United States is then at war to have the right of undisturbed transit of the canal, passed, 52 to 40, March 6.

title: Cosmos Knew Right Bait To Insure Hunt's Return
description: SOUTHAMPTON, Bermuda, March 11 Steve Hunt, the indefatigable little left wing of the Cosmos who runs so much he can probably win the New York City Marathon, made himself perfectly clear today: the national team of England is his only mountain top.

title: CITY COLLEGE TRAINS INNERCITY DOCTORS;
description: Three years after it found itself the center of a court battle over racial equality, the Biomedical Education Program at City,. College is quietly, but effectively, charting some new paths in American medical education.

title: Detroit Stunned by Recall Blitz
description: DETROIT  During 1977. the Ameri- can automobile industry recalled more cars than it sold. Some 10.4 million pas- senger cars of various model years recalled. 9.3 million new cars sold.

title: 52 Chance Triumphs in Big A Dash
description: Sigmund Sommer's Piece of Heaven, a 3-year-old colt who has been campaigning in Aqueduct since late December, held off the challenge of a couple of out-of-town shippers to score a convincing triumph in the $53,600 Swift Stakes at the Big A yesterday.

title: Births
description: Julio and Gloria (nee deAragon) are happy to announce the birth of their son, Julio Cesar, on March 6, 1978. The proud grandparents are Uva and Carlos Marquez Sterling and Lolita Dixson.

title: History Is in Harvest at Mahopac Farm
description: BALDWIN PLACE THE slim, nervous man in the farm loft could scarcely keep still. Puffing intently on a cigarette, he kept darting this way and that, and at every turn he pointed out neatly arranged piles upon piles of 19thcentury Americana: scores of old washtubs and wooden machines, dozens of old cameras and other photographic equipment, antique dolls and toys by the hundreds, old clocks and butter churns and medical tools of a bygone era.

title: HARD TO JAIL PIMPS, PROSECUTOR VOWS
description: A brace circled her neck above the revealing dcolletage of the flimsy turquoise cotton dress she wore in defiance of the weather when she arrived at the Manhattan District Attorney's office to complain of having been held captive for a week by a pimp who raped and beat her.

title: BRIDGE
description: Like oldtime prospectors, al most all bridgeplayers have had the experience of having the validity of a claim challenged by the opposition. In tournament play a director is available to settle the argument, but in rubber bridge game the players must do the best they can: The declarer must face his cards, make a statement of his intentions, and play on if required. He may not make a play based on an assumption about the location of opposing honor cards, and he can be required to draw, or not to draw, a missing trump that he has overlooked.

title: At Home: Paying Homage to the Fire Gods
description: 0 UR first conversational impulses exhausted, our minds and bodies lulled by food and drink, we gazed, my guests and I, into the fire. Each of us sees different things.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Timbuktur and Sam Shepard, too. Quite a lot cope with in a single wintertime week. At Timbuktu', for instance, you've got fight your way through an awful mess of feathers to get anywhere near the attractive people who, from time to time, sing the musical's songs. Timbuktu!, as if you didn't know, is an allblack variation on the earlier bauble-bangle-and-bean snow calla] Kismet, and it's still got the melodies borrowed from Borodin to keep itself warm: Stranger In Paradise, And This Is My Beloved, Night of My Nights (which I'd quite forgotten) and, of course, the B, B, and B Thing.

title: Lisa Pearson Is Engaged To Mark Allen Prescott
description: Lisa Jane Pearson and Mark Allen Prescott plan to be married in May at the home of the prospective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John F. Pearson of Great Neck. L.I.

title: The Upper West Side
description: In Manhattan's West Eighties, where I live, there is nothing to write about but people. Nature hardly exists, and the architecture, when it is not simply eccentric, can be seen from the street as representing nothing but the calculation of how much money can be squeezed each month out of these cubicles.

title: Bruin Five Prevails in Regional, 8376 Arkansas Wins
description: EUGENE, Ore., March 11The University of California, Los Angeles, rallied in the second half today to down Kansas, 8376, in a firstround game of the National Collegiate Athletic Association West regional tournament.

title: Dollar's Slide Carries Foreigners Prom Alpine Ski Slopes to Rockies
description: ASPEN, Colo., March 11The gnomes of Zurich are a long way from the slopes of Snowbird, Utah, but their trading in the international money markets is affecting ski resorts there and all over the country. As the dollar's value declines in relation to the yen, the pound, the franc and the mark, more and more foreigners are finding that a ski holiday in the United States is a bargain.

title: Raymond Timmons Arrested Again, On Charge of Beating Bronx Couple
description: Raymond Timmons, who like his twin brother. Ronald, has a long record of pushin muggings and assault charges against the elderly, was arrested Friday on similar charges.

title: Teachers at P S.188 in Spof f ord juvenile Center Again Ask f or Guards;
description: Citing two recent instances a injuries to teachers by students, the 23member teaching staff of Public School 188 at the Spofford Juvenile Center appealed anew for security guards last week as City Council committee hearings on the longtroubled Bronx center turned into a sort of graduate course in sociology,

title: The World;
description: Teng Hsiaoping was not named Prime Minister of China last week, but lit a sense he might as well have been. The National People's Congress, the country's nominal legislature, approved a series of measures and apphintments that reflected Mr. Teng's pragmatic views on economic progress, administrative professional ism and political stability.

title: FOOD
description: ENGLEWOOD 0 PENING a catering and carryout food business this winter is a risk that only the most daring people would take. And open is what Grand Cuisine Ltd. did at 105 South Dean Street, despite mountainous snows and freezing temperatures.

title: Center for Alcoholics Opens in East Side Town House
description: A fivestory town house at 133 East 162d Street was opened last week as center devoted to helping the city's estimated total of 400,000 alcoholics through education, prevention and referrals for treatment.

title: POLITICS
description: Although there was no doubt as to whom Mr. Byrne favored in the race, there was some doubt that he would endorse anyone and might just stay on the sideline.

title: A Disco for Singles and Their Children
description: The single parent's idea of a good time on a weekend may differ from that of the child. Children are forever begging to be taken to the circus, for example, even when the circus is not in town. The thing about the circus is one cannot buy a Bloody Mary there Also, one cannot socialize with other singles as at a disco, say.

title: Susan Grant, Arbitrator, Wed to Morton M. Libov
description: Susan Lee Grant, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Grant of Rockville Centre, L.I., was married yesterday evening to Morton M. Libov, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Irving Libov of Baltimore.

title: Lasts Three Seasons
description: The Animal Kingdom, is the play's first major revival since 1945, and I be lieve they have done us all a public service.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND;
description: THE issue of when lo wash the dishes after you've had company in to dinner did not inflame the Island until I had raised it with various friends. my wife and I have long enjoyed this controversy in the privacy of our home. She says that one should stay with the guests as long as possible and let the dishes pile up in the kitchen until after the people have gone. I, raised in the cafeteria school of hospitality. have always acted on the premise that relaxation and good talk are enjoyed only after all work is done.

title: POLITICS
description: CONSUMER activists who deal with broad national issues seem to be running against a new public mood. But to judge from conference in Hartford last weekend. they are busier and more effective than ever at the state and local levels, winning scattered victories over big busiriesses and government agencies, and, by the sheer weight of letters and telephone calls, causing politicians to take notice.

title: Hooting Crowd Disperses Nazis Attempting to March in South St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, March 11Members of the National Socialist Party of America were put to rout today by a hair of snowballs mixed with an occasional stone or bottle as they attempted to march through the shopping district of an old German neighborhood in South St. Louis.

title: Kentucky 85, Florida State 76 W. Kentucky 87, Syracuse 86
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., March 11 (AP) Led by Truman Claytor and Kyle Macy, Kentucky scored 14 straight points in the second half to rally and defeat Florida State, 8576, today m a firstround game of the N.C.A.A. Mideast regional tournament.

title: Dispute Over a Road in Adirondacks Heads for Court
description: Cascade Pass, one of the most beautiful vistas in the Adirondack Mountains, the focus of a bitter argument that will be heard in a Federal District Court suit in Syracuse on Tuesday.

title: St. Patrick's Parade Is Postponed in Boston
description: BOSTON, March 11 (UPI) - The ac cumulation of snow from this winter's storms has forced the postponement of the annua' St. Patrick's Day parade in South Boston.

title: Andre Harley, 67, Founder Of Cosmetics Package Concern
description: Andre Harley, president and founder of the House of Harley Inc., a cosmeticpackaging company, died Thursday at the Lenox Hill Hospital at the age of 67. He lived in Manhattan.

title: CETA Plan Aids Construction Jobless
description: ago, have at least one thing in common besides carpentrythey are wondering when and how they will get another job.

title: A New Challenge to Suffolk Sewer District
description: IT was 1969, and the second referendum on creation of the Southwest Sewer District in the Towns of Babylon and Islip was imminent. Newspapers were carrying advertise- menu in wnicn a woman was snown standing over a toilet bowl urging people to vote yes lest their drinking water be polluted by sewage.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Apocalypse. Nowadays, when you've something say to young people - the college generation - you must get the word to them through the kind of books they prefer. Paperbacks. That's why I've always insisted that my books be published simultaneously softcover and hard. So says Hal Lindsey, one of this decade's biggestselling authors.

title: Essex Split on Reform Ticket
description: NEWARK WITH the task of devising new voting pattern for Essex County finally behind them, individuals and organizations that led the charter-reform movement in the county are now maneuvering to seleCt candidates ior the elective positions that may reward their efforts.

title: Deaths
description: CROTTYJohn F., on March 10, 1978 of Yonkers, N.Y., beloved husband of the late Elsie, devoted father of Ruth Palomba, Jean Murphy and John A. Crotty. Reposing at Hastings Funeral HOrne, 15 Spring St, Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. Mass of Chris. tian Burial 10AM, Tuesday In St. Matthew's R.C. Church. Visiting 24, 79PM, Sunday and Monday.

title: Elizabeth Allen Affianced
description: The engagement of Elizabeth Allen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Barkley Allen of Moorestown, N. J., to Christopher Cathcart, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Edmond Cathcart of Lyme, Conn., has been announced by the future bride's parents. Miss Allen, an administrative assistant with the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, and her fianc, the assistant treasurer of the New York Life Insurance Company, will be married in September.

title: Jennifer Jacobs to Be Wed
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Edward Taylor Jacobs of Kingsport, Tenn., of the engagement of their daughter, Jennifer Lee Jacobs, to Mark Louis Golder, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Theodore Golder of Roslyn, L. I. The wedding will take place in Atlanta on May 27.

title: Lynne Marmet Is Fiancee of Harold K. McCombs
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Arthur Marmet of Washington have made known the engagement of their daughter, Lynne Marmet, to Harold Kelly McCombs Jr., son of Lieut. Col. Harold Kelly McCombs, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs. McCombs of Lindale, Tex.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: DONALD LOKUTA was born in Elizabeth and brought up in Union and, except for the time he spent getting his degree at Ohio State. has been a lifetime resident of New Jersey. But it wasn't until he returned from Ohio that he discoveredsawwith new eyes, is the way he puts ita part of the state that he had looked at for years but never seen.

title: HE SWEPT FASHION
description: To photojournalist Martin Munkacsi, it made sense photograph clothes the way they are wornin action. But in the 1930's it was revolutionary. For a decade the Hungarian set the pace for fashion photographers. Then he was eclipsed by his own followers. Now he in the spotlight again in a major New York show.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: of a media choice in reaching their customers? Don't our politicians deserve the mass exposure that only a commercial VHF station would provide?The Feb. 12 response of Adam Levin, director of the state's Division of Consumer Affairs, to the Jan. 1 column by Fred Ferretti, in which the latter outlined a consumers frustration in seek-ing help from Mr. Levin's agency, leaves me, as a New Jersey taxpayer, wondering about the effectiveness of the division.

title: The Male Animal
description: THE American male is not an endangered species, but his continued survival under so many grave, selfimposed handicaps is remarkable in itself. He must live with the myth of equal opportunity (anyone can achieve anything, and should), sexuality (he must be ready to make love instantly to anything willing to stand still  an erection at will is the moral equivalent of a valid credit card), and limited time (any age over 50 represents decline, and old age total incapacity). His role models often are adolescent well into middle age; he assents success and greed as values, but feels the insecurity they inevitably generate. On the other hand, he keeps going; it is the geriatric psychiatrist who picks up the pieces much of the time.

title: . . . A Guide to the New Tax Forms
description: result of her participation in an illegal strike. The state's Taylor Law makes it illegal for a public employee to strike under penalty of twice the worker's rate of pay. Half is to be wages not paid dur- ing the strike; the other half is to be de- ducted from an employee's salary HAlowing return to work. The teacher sought to deduct the second half as a business expense, but the court disagreed because Treasury Department regulations specifically 4r deductions of a penalty paid to a Government body for violating a law.

title: Dogs Good, People Bad
description: The protagonists are two dogs who are being used for quasiscientific experiments. They escape the vivisectionists, reject the world of human masters and try to become wild animals with the help of a fox. A newsman hypes their story by starting a bubonic plague scare  the plague ostensibly spread by the escaped dogs and the story hangs on the allout pursuit.

title: Soviet Bars Deal on Neutron Bomb
description: MOSCOW, March 11The Soviet Union I rejected implioitly today a suggestion by Secretary of Defense Harold Brown that the United States might be able to use the neutron bomb as a bargaining chip to negotiate mutual restraint in the production of new types of weapons.

title: Editors Choice
description: DISCIPLINE AND PUNISH, by Michel Foucault. Translated by Alan Sheridan. (Pantheon Books, $10.95.) An erudite examination of the social assumptions underlying the creation of the modern prison. .-

title: Nairobi's Hunting-Trophy Shops Crowded is Ban on Sales Nears
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 11 (Reuters)Bargainhunters crowded into gametrophy shops here today, eager to buy before a Government ban on trophy sales takes effect at midnight tomorrow.

title: BUDDING PRINTS
description: These are the kinds of summer clothes that everyone likes  parents because they're pretty and classic: children because they are cool and comfortable. For girls there are sundresses (often with shawls, echoing adult fashion) in English country garden prints: for boys, pants and shirts in fresh colors, stripes and plaids.

title: Rampal Offers First Master Class
description: JeanPierre Rampal, the flutist will give his first public master class next Thursday at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A Ten students will take part in the class, which will last from 10 A.M. to 5 P.M., with time out for lunch. Auditors will be admitted for fee of $12.50.

title: Kathleen Geoghan Engaged
description: Kathleen Hart Geoghan and Richar Henry Remmer plan to he married on June 17. Mrs. Wallace F. Bryan and Walter P. Geoghan, both of Bayport, L. I., have announced their daughter's I engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Remmer of Oakdale, L. I.

title: Some Common Mistakes, Old and New
description: The new tax forms that resulted from the Tax Simplification and Reduction Act of..1977 are designed to make life easier for taxpayers - and indeed the percentage of mistakes in the first 25 million tax returns filed is down from last year. Nevertheless, the Internal Revenue Service. reports a sIgnifiotnt number of errors related to the revamped terminology and format of the forms.

title: Beauty
description: Kids lib is making progress. Two full acres at Macy's are now devoted solely to children. Madison Avenue recently added Pumpkins and Monkeys, a complete fourstory children's boutime. to its roster of chic shops. All over the country, new stores for children are popping up like jack-in-theboxes. Children can choose clothes from among any number of designer labels. But it's not just clothes that are being designed expressly for children. Hairstyles are, too. In New York, children can even have their hair styled by expert cutters trained by master hairdresser Kenneth Battelle.

title: Barbara Haas To. Be a Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Skerrett Haas of Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Jane Haas, to Gregg Bernard Nelson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Bernard Nelson of Sweet Home, Ore.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: THE CONSERVATIVES

title: Levitt Warns That Fire Department Pension Fund Faces Insolvency Unless Contributions Are Increased
description: In a report highly critical of city officials and the trustees of the Fire Department Pension Fund, the office of State Comptroller Arthur Levitt declared yesterday that the city might have to increase its contribution to the deficitridden fund by as much as $35 million in the coming fiscal year to keep it solvent.

title: KOREA INQUIRIES GET LIMELIGHT THIS WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, March 11The investigations into alleged Korean influencebuying here will break into the public eye next week after months of behindthescenes inquiries and interrogations.

title: U.S. May Deport Alleged ExNazi For Bonn to Try
description: ALBANY, March 11The Federal Government has made inquiries with West German authorities about the possible extradition of Vilis A. Hazners, a 73-yearold Latvian emigre, for trial as a war criminal.

title: Smithsonian to Study California Meteorite
description: WASHINGTON, March 11 (AP)The Old Wom'n Mountain's meteorite, the second largest ever to fall in the United States, has arrived at the Smithsonian's Museum of Natural History from Barstow, Calif.

title: Terrorist Offensive Against Israel
description: The raid by Palestinian guerrillas in which more than 20 Israelis were killed near Tel Aviv yesterday appeared to be a return to the wave of terrorist a tacks several years ago that caused heavy Israeli casualties. Often those actions were staged by suicide units and provoked Israeli military reprisals.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, March 11 (AP)Comptroller General Elmer B. Staats. the head of the General Accounting Office, has warned the Carter Administration that it cannot legally spend taxpayers money to terminate the controversial Clinch River breeder reactor.

title: DINING OUT;
description: MEN don't really like soup, former President Richard M. Nixon said, according to the recently released book by H. R. Haldeman. One hesitates to dispute so olympian a judgment, but we suspect Mr. Nixon was transterring a personal prejuaice to men generally. In our acquaintance, at least, most men with any knowledge of food at all are highly particular about their soups.

title: Queens 74, South. Conn. 62
description: Althea Gywne scored 21 points and grabbed 13 rebounds to lead Queens College to a 7462 victory over Southern Connecticut last night in the Eastern regional final of the Association for intercollegiate Athlectics for Women playoffs at the Queens College gym in Flushing.

title: WHITE HOUSE BEGINS A PERSONNEL REVIEW
description: WASHINGTON, March 11The White House, straining under the pressures of the coal strike, the Panama Canal treaty and the energy bill, has begun a comprehensive review of th' President's staff in an effort to improve its quality and efficiency, a senior White House aide said today.

title: TERRY JOHNSON KING
description: MIAMI, March 11 (AP)Terry Johnson King, a columnist and travel editor of The Miami News who wrote a series of articles on her bout with cancer, died of the disease yesterday. She was 481 years old.

title: STAMPS
description: The worst form of smallpoxthe smallpox that kills, blinds and maimshas been eradicated from the world, and the United Nations, whose specialized agency, the World Health Organization, had so much to do with the victory, is issuing on March 31 four commemoratives to mark the Global Eradication of Smallpox.

title: Two Spanish Socialists to Visit For Talks With U.S. on Defense
description: MADRID, March 11 (ReuterslThe Socialist Party's experts on defense, Enrique Mugica and Luis Solana, plan to leave tomorrow for the United States for talks with American officials on the party's stand on defense matters,

title: NORWALK NURSES APPROVE CONTRACT ENDING STRIKE
description: Registered nurses at Norwalk Hospital unanimously approved a two-and-a-halfyear contract yesterday that will end weekold strike by their union, the Connecticut Health Care Association, against the 407bed facility. They will be back on the job by the end of the weekend, accorclina to a hospital spokesman,

title: Miss Fratianne's Failure: A Matter of Opinion
description: OTTAWA, March 11In a heavyweight title fight, it would have been a controversial split decision. In a tennis match, it would have been a fivesetter decided by a disputed line call.

title: Helsinki Revisited Was a Series of Caucuses and Conflicts
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia - Not long ago a Soviet diplo- mat was talking with a State Department official in Washing- ton. You won three years ago in Helsinki, he said. I win the next one.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: Theresa C. Vara, writing on What Feminists Really Believe [Feb. 261, upbraids Annelies Lengers for her extremely limited knowledge of feminism, and her narrow accusations against feminists.

title: Follow-Up on the News
description: Jan. 22, 1968: The Pueblo. a Navy electronic intelligence ship, is seized by North Korean military forces in the Sea of Japan and taken to Wonskn Harbor. Her 83 crew members begin harsh imprisonment as spies.

title: Trends in New Music on Disks
description: Critics of the contemporary arts who talk about eclecticism and flux should always be regarded with suspicion. New music has often been referred to as eclectic, yet in 50 or 100 years will all be neatly categorized by music historians.

title: Sikkim's Crown Prince Is Killed
description: NEW DELHI,March 11 (AP)The Crown Prince of Sikkim, Tenzing Namgyal, was killed in an automobile accident today in the Sikkimese capital of Gangtok, the Indian press agency Samachar reported. It said that the car carrying the 25-year-old prince had collided with a truck on a hill and plunged into a ravine. The Himalayan kingdom of Sikkim was annexed by India in 1975.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: The real male chauvinist, according to John T. Molloy, is a man in a threepiece pinstripe suit who says to a woman: Wear anything your little old heart desires to the office. That kind of man really doesn't like women very much, Mr. Molloy said the other day, sounding very serious.

title: Homely, Yes, but Historical
description: No Colonial V.I.P. ever slept there. Had one been invited, and had he accepted, he could have, though, for the building was there. Over the years, of course, many people did sleep there, but the chances are nobody ever will again.

title: Sunday Observer
description: We are in the White House Disaster Room. Everyone is hard at work trying to make a disaster. Without success.

title: POLITICS
description: MANY of Assemblyman Irwin J. Landes's fellow politicians are writing his political obituary because df.his legal and tax problems, but the Great Neck Democrat isn't ready to lie down yet.

title: Faded Long Beach Feels It's Ripe For Renewed Glory With Casinos;
description: LONG BEACH, L.I.Like a grayhaired woman sitting at the window of a faded seaside hotel and waiting to be warmed by the winter sun, the City of Long Beach, its boardwalk and buildings silvered by nearly a century of hard weather and use, is hoping that gambling casinos, which have been proposed, may bring a new, golden era.

title: Deaths
description: WALDMAN  Berm Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun mourns the passing of the beloved mother of its es teemed member. Israel Waldman, and extends its fullest sympathy to all the members of the bereaved family.

title: The Impostor;
description: Day was treading timidly on the heels of night when the telephone rang in a room in the Kenmore Hotel in Boston. Through the log of sleep, the caller's brassy voice sounded familiar but only vaguely so. The conversation, if you could call it that, went like this:

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: A sparkling revival of Ferenc Molnar's The Play's the Thing, which is a comedy about playwriting, recently opened at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Because the play is basically a gamea sophisticated but slight charadethe effectiveness of a revival rests on a company's gamesman- ship, The Times's Mel Gussow wrote. Mr. Gussow then proceeded to roundly praise director Frank Dunlop and his company of actors, particularly Rene Auberjonois whose timing is impeccable, George Rose as a resourceful and inventive actor, and Kurt Kasznar who brings enormous authority to his role. The play closes, on schedule, next Sunday. (See Theater)

title: Gottfried Tops Newcombe; U.S. Clinches NetSeries
description: NEW HAVEN, March 11World Cup tennis continued taking on the.onesidedness of Anierica's Cup yachting today as the United States clinched its third straight conquest of Australia.

title: The Nation;
description: Since Thanksgiving, a deadlock among senators over naturalgas pricing has turned the Congressional energy conference into the legislative equivalent of a play without end, and just as tiresome. Last week, the senators finally took a giant step toward an agreement, but may find their effort undercut by as big a step backwards.

title: At Home: Fire Company
description: OUR first conversational impulses exhausted, our minds and bodies lulled by food and drink, we gaze, my guests and I, into the fire.

title: INTERVIEW
description: LIKE most of the state's mayors, John F. Curran of River Edge is concerned with the accelerating Pressures for regionalization. Mayor Curran knows that the problem is widespread, since he is president of the Bergen County Democratic Mayors Association, which includes present or former mayors representing 43 of Bergen's 70 municipalities.

title: G.O.P. Leaders Lean To SchoolAid Plan Based on Enrollment
description: ALBANY, March 10The leadership of the Republicancontrolled Senate is leaning, for the first time, toward a schoolaid formula based partly on enrollment rather than only on attendancebut not to the extent that Governor Carey proposed in his budget for the coming year.

title: Ancient Rug Craft Wears Thin as Iran Develops Industries
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 7As Iran is straining to join the industrialized world, an ancient craft, the weaving of carpets. is in trouble.

title: Medical Center One Year Later: Still Showing Some Ailments
description: VALHALLA THE highrisk obstetrical ward at the Westchester County Medical Center contains only stacked beds, gathering debt, as Daniel J. Armet, the chief executive officer, puts it. An intensivecare neonatal unit is aarK ana aDandoned. But elsewhere in the vast medical structure, now the subject of renewed debate, there is a contrasting scene. A $600,000 cat scanner revolves as its Xrays locate abnormalities. In the next room $500,000 cardiac catheterization unit is also heavily booked.

title: DEMOCRATS PREPARE TO SELECT DELEGATES
description: The Democratic State Committee has started laying the groundwork for one of the most significant advances by wonlen in politicsthe mandatory equal appqrtionment by sex of New York State's 91 delegates to the national Dembcratic Party conference next December.

title: Growth Stocks: The New Crop
description: Where have they gone, those mighty performers of five years ago, those glamour issues that epitomized the notion of a growth stock? Nowhere, is where they have gone.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Dangers of Auto Racing; Giving Jobs to Amateurs
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Schoolteacher Discovers Her Place in the Sky
description: When Perry Hicks Jordan was teacher in Charlotte, N.C., she would look out the school window at the blue, cloudless sky and wish she were up there.

title: Mets Keep Losing Habit; Messersmith a Standout
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 11The New York Mets crossed into their new era today with fresh faces at nearly every position, with fresh assurance from their owner that the ball club was not for sale and with an oldfashioned 43 loss to the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: U.S. Seeking Soviet Accord on Observers in Ethiopia
description: WASHINGTON, March 11The United States today intensified its efforts to gain Soviet cooperation in establishing a corps of neutral international observers to verify a ceasefire in Ethiopia and try to safeguard ethnic Somalis in the Ogaden region against reprisals by Ethiopian troops.

title: The Terror Again
description: Just when the stalled Mideast peace negotiations were apparently about to enter a new and more hopeful phase with the visit of Prime Minister Mena- chem Begin to Washington, they have been savagely shunted aside by the worst terrorist incident in Israel in years.

title: Leisure Class and Throwaway Glass
description: LAST week in Hartford, the Contiecticut Legislature heard testimony on the Bottle Bill (mandatory deposits for beverage containers) for the seventh consecutive year. And for the seventh consecutive year, the flower of the community spoke in support of the bill.

title: DETECTIVES SEEK DATA IN TOLL BOOTH SLAYING
description: Homicide detectives of the Westchester County Parkway Police yesterday were seeking information about the occupants of a car who shot to death 55-year-old toll collector minutes before he was to go off duty Friday night.

title: BEGIN PUTS OFF TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, March 11  Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel postponed today by at least 24 hours his departure for the United States because of the Palestinian attack on an Israeli bus, a raid that President Carter later called an outrageous act of lawlessness and senseless brutality.

title: Connecticut Police Guard Woman Who Linked Two Men to Reilly Case
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 11An unidentified woman who is being held in protective custody is understood to have implicated two men in the case in which Peter A. Reilly was convicted and then cleared of the murder of his mother.

title: Where You Can Learn
description: Although tap classes for the young are commonplace, adulteducation programs and private dance studios have begun to offer instruction for adults. Students must provide their own tap shoes, usually $15 and up, and comfortable clothing such as leotards and tights are recommended. The list that follows is merely a guide and is not definitive.

title: Henry D. Mercer Is Dead at 84; Founder of Steamship Company
description: Henry Dickson Mercer, who was railroad stenographer at the age of 17 and eventually went on to found what became one of the country's largest privately owned steamship companies, died Friday evening in his sleep at his winter home in Lyford Cay, Nassau. He was 84 years old.

title: Lidia Passarelli Affianced
description: The engagement of Lidia M. Passarelli to Leonard R. Gerstein has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph P. Passarelli, parents of the bride-to-be. Her fianc is the son of Mr, and Mrs. Murray Gerstein. Both families are of New Rochelle, N.Y. A July wedding is planned.

title: A Message For Mr. Begin
description: Two unhappy developmenti have now dramatized the intense emotions aroused by recent events in the Middle East, as well as the dangers those emotions pose for rational policy-making.

title: Nastase Beats Vilas
description: MADRID, March 11 (UPI)Ilie Nastase defeated Guillermo Vilas, 63, 62, 62, today and gave Europe a 32 lead over South America in the $175,000 International Tennis Cup.

title: Summer Youth Jobs Open for Applications
description: The city begins accepting applications tomorrow for the 55,000 federally financed summer youth jobs it will offer this year.

title: Friendly People
description: THERE are 45 books by William Saroyan listed in the front of Chance Meetings: nine novels, 15 collections of short stories, 14 of plays and, not counting this one, seven memoirs. The first book was published 44 years ago. He's pushing 70 now, will be there this year, and I guess he's slowing down the books only come out every couple of years now. His entry in Who's Who in America tells us I'm here... I have been all of the intervening years, and I still am all of them....

title: An Ornery Spirit in Coal Country
description: LOGAN, W. Va., March 10When Joseph Hensley was an auto worker and a butcher in Ohio, he noticed that his coworkers, unlike the coal miners he had known back h'me, wouldn't stick together as muchthey'd take a sick day they didn't like what was happening, but they wouldn't fight back,

title: Sandra Warfield, Mezzo, Makes Debut as a Recitalist
description: Although Sandra Warfield sang at the Metropolitan Opera for many years the last time six years agoshe had not appeared in concert in this city. On Friday night, the mezzosoprano made a belated debut as a recitalist in Alice Tully Hall, with John Atkins as her skillful pianist.

title: Arabs and Other Students Plan Protest Over Trial By Israel of a U.S. Citizen
description: A coalition of ArabAmericans, student groups and civilrights activists .has joined in, support of a Palestinian-American: imprisoned in Israel on political charges.

title: Sarah Rob Is Bride Of Dr. Peter Podore
description: Sarah Rebecca Rob, a nurse on the infant pediatrics staff at Strong Memorial Hospital in Rochester, was married there at noon yesterday to Dr. Peter Charles Podore, an intern at Strong. Judge Hugh Jones of the State Court of Appeals in Albany performed the ceremony in the Chatterbox Club.

title: Les Paul: Rhythm in the Ramapos
description: OAKLAND THE multitrack world of Les Pauithe blending of a sometime guitarist, composer, inventor, electronics expert, entrepreneur and fulltime planner and dreamersprings into life in Mr. Paul's home in the Ramapo Mountains.

title: Future of the Chrysler Building Is Looking Up
description: As Edward S. Gordon strode through the lobby of the Chrysler Building, ha pointed his finger at the crack that ran all the way across the glass covering the directory on the wall. Look at that, he said. What is this place, a loft building on 23d Street? For a long time, the Chrysler Building, the city's masterpiece of Art Deco and one of the niost famous skyscrapers, v. as run like a piece of brokendown real estate. Occupancy fell to 58 percent, services dropped, and the building, for all the celebration it received in architectual circles, was known among real estate people as dying property.

title: East Germans Hear LoseWeight Pleas
description: EAST BERLIN, March 11 (Reuters)After a series of unsuccessful press campaigns to persuade overweight citizensone in four of East Germansto take steps to thin down, the Government is now taking to the air with its appeals.

title: IN BRIEF
description: Food prices jumped 2.9 percent last month and sent the Index of Finished Goods - the Bureau of Labor Statistics replacement for the old Wholesale Price Index - up 1.1 percent. The bureau at- tributed the foodprice rise partly to se- vere weather, which hampered the delivery of some groceries. The surge in prices of finished goods, following a 0.8 percent jump in consumer prices in January, added to fears of a return of doubledigit inflation. . .The inclement weather also crimped consumer borrowing,"which expanded by only $2.4 bit lion in January to $215.9 billion - the smallest increase since last September; according to the Federal Reserve Board.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: Your piece on corporation spouses [Feb. 12] had a familiar ring to it. For go many years, corporation wives have been doomed to silent suffering  perhaps drinking too much, depressed, or just generally without meaningful relationships or roots  because of the organizational policy of repeatedly relocating families as the route up the executive career ladder for their husbands.

title: Opera: Don Giovanni at the Met
description: Don Giovanni, bespeckled with new figures, came to the Metropolitlin Opera Friday night far the first time this season. Boan Sutherland, e course, was familiar. But Jiblia Varidy and Sohn Brecknock made their deauts as EDitu and Ottavio, and Vuguette Tourangeau and Allan Monk sang their first Zerlina and Massetto at the house. Aichart Borvnge, dip conduelet, had never before led the 14:ozart opera here, and Gabriel Bacquier, the Leporello, was still another appearing in this role for the first time at the Metropolitan.

title: Authenticity Is All, So Sturbridge Gave Up Mowing the Common
description: When Cynthia Robinson was in the third grade at the Fieldston School in the Bronx, her class made an intensive study of American Indians and, as far as  possible, lived as early American Indians. Cynthia and her classmates took Indian names, made and wore Indian  moccasins and chewed pemmican for school snacks.

title: Drive on Argentine Leftists Takes Toll of Journalists
description: BUENOS AIRES. March 11 (AP)In the last four years more than 35 journalists have been killed In Argentina, 30 have been arrested and scores more have left the country after receiving death threats.

title: Strike Ends at Israeli Airport
description: TEL AVIV, March 11. (Reuters)BenGurion International Airport reopened this afternoon at the end of a 24hour strike by civil aviation employees over average dispute.

title: The German Miracle
description: BONNAt first blush, the West German business community ought to be riding high. With an annual inflation rate running well below 4 percent and comfortable trade surplus of at least $10$12 billion per year, the West German economy might seem the Wirtschaftswunder (The Economic Miracle) the world believes it to be. But the gloom these days in the great industrial agglomerations of the Ruhr and in the mighty financial and trade centers of Frankfurt and Hamburg is palpable.

title: For Montclair, A Mighty Chorus
description: William Mac McClellan, now in his 32d year of teaching, conducting, inspiring and forbidding unnecessary breathing, is an institution in Montclair. And next Saturday, when the curtain goes up on the 1 I th annual Music Department Concert at Montclair High School, two generations of McClellan disciples will be represented in the massive chorus.

title: Film MusicalsRock Calls the Tune
description: The movie musical, which Hollywood used to do better than anyone else, has been in cold storage for several years. Now it seems to be hot ticket again. with one big difference: the music is rock and disco. The opening this Friday of American Hot Wax, which centers around the rise and fall of Alan Freed, the flamboyant 1950's disk jockey, marks the begin- ning of a parade of musical films scheduled for release during the next six months that will attempt to match the success of the current hit Saturday Night Fever. The entries range from adaptations of the Broadway musicals Grease, The Wiz and Hair to a film based on the 1967 Beatles album Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band. Others will include The Buddy Holly Story, based on the life of the late rock-and-roll singer; FM, set in presentday radio station; Thank God It's Friday, revolving around an opulent disco; and Almost Summer and I Wanna Hold Your Hand, with plots involving teenage rock fans.

description: In war, the idea is to stop fighting and start negotiating. The opposite is true in boxing.

description: WASHINGTON, March 11Sears, Roe. buck & Company, which has been charged with job discrimination by the Tqu41 Employment Opportunity Commission, has asked that the case be dismissed on the ground that the Government agency came under the improper influence of the National Organization for Women.

description: It was incorrectly reported in Weekend on March 3 that the artist Christo would receive proceeds from his Wrapped Modern Art Book. Instead, the money will be used to subsidize Running- Fence, another Abrams publication.

description: WASHINGTON, March 11In the latest phase of the battle for a VHF televidun channel for New Jersey, the state h seeking to have Congress establish the maple that every state is entitled to at least one VHF assignment

title: Time to Save MiddleIncome Housing
description: In 1955, New York State's MitchellLama program was set up to stimulate the building of apartment houses for moderateincome families by making Government loans to private developers. More than 100,000 families now live in such houses. While many of the developments are in fine shape, financially and physically, more are not. Many owe the state or city large mortgage arrears, and the cash reserves intended to pay for maintenance have gone for day-to-day operating costs. Thousands older families and households with childrenwhom the program was meant to serveface painfully high rents to keep their homes.

title: Plastics Replace Metal in Effort to Save Weight and Fuel
description: In order to meet the 1985 Federal fuel consumption goals, the average American car will shed 1,250 pounds. A good part Of the saving will come from increased use of plastics by the auto industry.

description: .PHILADELPHIA, March 12Keven 'McDonald's long wait ended today. The 6-foot-6-inch senior forward, playing in his first National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament game. scored a career high of 37 points

description: Showcased in the world's most famous gymnasium, United States gymnastics- received a dramatic boost yesterday when Kurt Thomas swept the men's events and Kathy. Johnson finished second among the women in the prestigious American Cup competition.

The Redmen, shackled by a poor shooting performance, were ousted by Louisville, 7668.

title: French Town a Testing Ground for Leftists
description: CONFLANS - SAINTE - HONORINE, France,March 12In the long campaign leading up today's legislative elections in France, the essential questions have been: How much has the country shifted toward the left, and how willing are the Communists and Socialists to share these gains?

title: G.A.O. Says Carter Cannot Halt Development of Clinch River Reactor
description: WASHINGTON, March 12The General Accounting Office has told President Carter that he cannot legally halt the development of a plutoniumpowered reactor that the President has warned could lead to the spread of nuclear weapons.

For the second year in a row they lost three players who became free agents: Ross Grimsley, Dick Drago and Elliott Maddox. The previous winter Reggie Jackson, Bobby Grich and Wayne Garland left for wealthier pastures.

title: Contracting Domestic Zinc Industry Seeks Protection as Imports Rise
description: The nation's zinc industry, which has 'shrunk to roughly half its former size in a decade, is pushing hard to get tariff protection against the imports that threaten the remaining producers, now capable of supplying only a little more than half of the economy's needs.

title: Sports Guide
description: As an organized sport, paddleballthat fastmoving offshoot of onewall handballis only about 20 years old, but it has developed some stars. The little black ball that the players slam can come back off the wall at more than 100 miles an hour. and the best competitors in the United States will be making such shots in the finals of the American Paddleball Association's tournament. The site is Queensborough Community College, on Springfield Boulevard in Bayside. Watch the way they play the angles, and watch how far they go to retrieve a ball, advises one of the top players, Myron Zwirn of North Woodmere, L.I. There will be men's and a women's champion, and masters doubles champions. Play begins at 6:30 P.M. There is no admission fee.

title: An Evening of Works by Fennimore
description: JOSEPH FENNIMORE, whose music was performed Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, is a graduate of the Eastman and Juilliard Schools who began his career as a pianist. He switched to composing around 1970. His teachers included Virgil Thomson:

description: WASHINGTON, March 12With. tne improvement in its relations with West Germany, the United State's has decided to go ahead with plans for a fourth economic summit meeting of Western industrial leaders, probably in July in Bonn.

title: Grady Captures Badminton Crown
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 12 Don Brady ran seven points from 811 in the third game and won the Middle Atlantic badminton championship today, He beat Ken Priestman, 152, 1517, 1511, at the Germantown Cricket Club. Both are from Toronto.

description: As late as about three years ago, the police would not venture into the lobby of the Woodstock Hotel on West 43d Street in Manhattan without a backup team outside. Drug addicts mixed methadone and wine in the lobby. Prostitutes loitered in the hallways. Alcoholics and panhandlers gathered outside. Fires and breakins were common.

description: MILAN. Italy, March 12Vladimir Yashchenko of the Soviet Union broke his world record in the high jump tonight as the bar quivered and quaked but remained in place after his third and last attempt at 7 feet 81/2 inches.

title: Music: Horowitz Plays Liszt Sonata
description: LAST JANUARY. Vladimir Horowitz played the Rachmaninofr Piano Concerto in D minor, a work he had not touched for some 25 years. Yesterday afternoon in Carnegie Hall he again looked back. He played the Liszt Sonata in B minor, one of his warhorses in the 1930's (his 1932 recording is one of the alltime great piano records) but which had been absent from his repertory for decades. He had played the work at his first American recital, 50 years ago in Carnegie Hall. Now, during his Golden Jubilee Year, he is bringing back.

title: When the Cup of Advice Spills Over Daily
description: Jesse Bryant is a psychiatrist from Greenwich Village who ministers to the ills of an entire city. His ministry is a sideline.

title: CORRECTION
description: It was incorrectly reported in Weekend on March 3 that the artist Christo would receive proceeds froitt his Wrapped Modern Art Book. Instead, the money will he used to subsidize Running Fence, another Abrams Original publication.

title: Pistons Top Nets as Lanier, King Battle
description: PISCATAWAY, NJ.March 12With 4 minutes 28 seconds left in the Detroit Pistons 130125 victory over the New Jersey Nets at Rutgers gymnasium today, Dick Bavetta, an official, went to the press table and said to some friends t'at he hadn't seen anything like this game since officiating in the Holcombe Rucker Summer League in Harlem.

title: LEFTISTS IN FRANCE GIVEN SLIM MAJORITY IN FIRSTROUND VOTE
description: PARIS, Monday, March 13The leftist opposition won a bare majority in yesterday's French legislative elections, according to projections based on incomplete but widespread returns. But the opposition parties lead over the conservative Government coalition was too narrow to assure their earlier confident predictions of victory in the final round of voting next Sunday.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OSLO, March 12 (AP)Eric Heiden of Madison, Wis., broke the world speedskating record in the 1,000 meters today at Savalan, a rink high in the mountains of central Norway, clocking 1 minute 14.99 seconds.

title: Sweet 16: Makeup Lesson Was the Surprise
description: That's what I call style, said Gail Negbauer's kid brother, Gary, 11, when the waiters at the Pierre Hotel wheeled in her birthday cake aflame with 16 candles. Brad Negbauer. 12. agreed.

title: Money for Women Only
description: Exxon gave $10,000, and Johnson & Johnson half that. Jacqueline Onassis donated $2,500 and said she would speak to her friends. And several individuals have anonymously given thousands of dollars in contributions to foundation most people have never heard of, for projects that most other foundations would not handle.

title: Grenzen Scores In Coast Stakes
description: ARCADIA. Calif., March 12 (AP)Grenzen, ridden by Darrel McHargue, captured the $81,550 Santa Susana Stakes by five lengths today and won Santa Anita's 3-year-old filly championship.

title: Coal Bargaining Moves Forward But the Back-to-Work Order Holds
description: WASHINGTON, March 12Negotiators revising the rejected coal settlement reported progress and forward movement today but no agreement to end the 97day miners strike.

title: GOING OUT Guide

title: Shift Urged for Voice of America
description: WASHINGTON, March 12An. independent panel set up to examine the role of foreign correspondents in the Voice of America has recommended that the Government's overseas broadcasting system shift its reporters to the developing, underdeveloped and Communist areas of the world.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 13, 1978

title: College Job Offers Up 31% Over 1977, A Survey Discloses
description: The job market for college graduates looks generally better this year than did last year, but for graduates with master's degrees it seems to be worse.

title: Advertising
description: Faced wtih growing public hositility toward its membership, the American Federation of State, County and Municial Employees will this week launch a $1 million image advertising effort with the help of the Washington office of the J. Walter Thompson Company.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 12Palestinians went on the alert today in refugee camps and military posts throughout Lebanon, fearing reprisals for the raid yesterday in which 37 Israelis were killed.

Watson of New Canaan. Conn. The ceremony was performed at the Rye (N.Y.) Town Hilton by the Rev. Peter Samson of the Rye Community Unitarian Church.

description: SAN SALVADOR, March 12 (Reuters)Salvadorans began voting today for municipal representatives as security forces were placed on the alert for possible violence by leftwing extremists.

description: TRENTON, March 10A joint committee of the two houses of the New Jersey Legislature will meet Monday to get public reaction to a bill that would speed the opening of gambling casinos at Atlantic City.

title: Jazz. Confronto Quartet
description: THE CONFRONTO QUARTET is A West German ensemble per- forming the works of Werner Heider, a pianist. The quartet appeared Saturday night at the Kitchen in a program entitled Chamber Music and Jazz. The idea was to illuminate the parallels between certain sorts of semistructured, semiimprovisatory classical new music and experimental jazz.

title: 1978 Pretax Profits Expected to Rise 11%
description: Bullish businessmen are looking for combination of increased demand, tighter cost controls and lower taxes to increase pretax profits this year by 11 percent to a record $179.5 billion, according to a survey by the McGrawHill Publications Company.

title: Circus Elephant Kills Caretaker
description: CHICAGO, March 12 (AP)A threeton Indian circus elephant killed a caretaker yesterday after throwing him with its trunk and kicking him into a pillar, witnesses said. Several dozen bystanders looked on in horror as the egraged ele-

description: Tottenville High School of Staten Island won the Public Schools Athletic League gymnastics championship Saturday by defeating Bushwick High School in the final. 120.5 points to 112.55.

title: Begin Hints Strongly at Reprisal For Attack in Which 46 Perished
description: JERUSALEM, March 12Prime Minister Menachem Begin, his voice trembling and sometimes faltering, his eyes rimmed red and his bearing that of a mourner, hinted strongly today that Israel would stage a military reprisal for the terrorist attack yesterday that took the lives of 36 Israelis and an American living in Israel. Nine guerrilla raiders also died,

description: PETWORTH, ENGLAND In an attempt to extend the aphorism that dog is man's best friend, 83-year-old Florence Nagle, one of Britain's most, respected trainers and breeders, is suing the powerful, allmale Kennel Club on charges of sex discrimination.

description: The bond market last week, buoyed by a more stable dollar and another surprising decline in the nation's money supply, scored its strongest gain since midNovember, and dealers increasingly began to argue that the uptrend in prices might very well continue this week.

title: U.S. Seizes Panamanian Vessel With Large Cargo of Marijuana
description: MIAMI, March 12 (UPI)The Coast Guard cutter Diligence has seized a 136foot Panamanian vessel carrying an estimated 50 tons of marijuana, a Coast Guard spokesman reported yesterday.

description: PARIS, March 12A firm commitment by the Carter Administration and the West German Government to stabilize the dollar, coupled with an expansion of the funds available for this purpose, are understood to be major elements in new currencystabilization agreetnent put together by the two Governments this weekend and due to be formally announced tomorrow.

title: Rev. Robert I. Gannon Dies at 84; Former President of Fordham U.
description: The Rev. Robert Ignatius Gannon, the president of Fordham University from 1936 to 1949 and an eider statesman the Society of Jesus, died yesterday morning at St. Vincent's Hospital at the age of 84. He was a resident of the St Ignatius Retreat House in Manhassal LI., where he served as retreat master until about six months ago.

description: The temperature hit a high of 56 .degrees yesterday, but, according to a spokesman for the National Weather Service, was not really that warm, only about eight degrees above normal.

description: MIAMI, March 12Tom Weiskopf stood off a finalround attack by his old friend, Jack Nicklaus, today and won the DoralEastern open by a single stroke.

description: RSPORTS arriving from various redoubts suggest loud discord dominates professional boxing. Unfortunately the discord isn't yet serious enough to make anybody want to fight. First, Leon Spinks won the heavyweight championship from Muhammad Ali, although he had injured a rib while training, The pain inspired Spinks, who is afraid of nothing except a competent dentist.

title: Life's Hope Wins
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 12 (UPI)Life's Hope, an 11-to-1 shot, came on in the stretch today to defeat Silver Series, the favorite, winning the $100,000 New Orleans Handicap in record time, Chris McCarron piloted the win ner to a 2:02.2 clocking, two seconds faster than the 62-year-old Fair Grounds record for the 1%mile race. Silver Series, carrying Angel Cordero at top weight of 123 pounds, took the lead early in the stretch before Life's Hope pulled ahead to win by a length.

description: ACOUPLE of years ago Ken. Norton was featured a biggrossing movie called Mandingo. title: Preminger Gets Rights To Greene's New Novel
description: Motion picture rights to Graham Greene's novel The Human Factor, published last month by Simon & Schuster, have been acquired by Otto Preminger. The price, according to a reliable source, was $300,060. The suspense spy story centers on a 62-yearold London operative in the British Secret Service who turns out to be doubleagent passing information to the Russians. Mr. Preminger said he was discusing doing the screenplay with the agents for several writers. A date for production of the film has not been set.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Article 2 -- No Title

title: Jersey's 5Year, $40 Million Plan Seeks to Halt OceanFront Erosion
description: New Jersey plans to spend $40 million in the next five years in a possibly losing battle against a relentless foe, the Atlantic Ocean, which is rising slowly each year and constantly changing the face of the coastline from Sandy Hook to Cape May. It is a battle officials concede, they can never win; the most they can expect is a standoff.

title: World of Broadcasting in Italy Is a jungle of Competition
description: ROME. March 12A sultry Hungarianaccented voice tells erotic tales on latenight radio, while on another station an extreme Ieftwing group gives detailed accounts of police movements during demonstration. On television a housewife performs a striptease in exchange for fur coat while another station closes its day with a prayer.

title: Urban Development Bank: Departments Dispute Who Should Run
description: WASHINGTON, March 12When his staff hands him a package of plans for an urban policy within the next few days, probably the most important decision President Carter will face is what to do with the proposed urban development bank.

title: Commodities
description: With spring fast approaching, the demand for hamburger meat will be rising with temperatures across the nation. And so will the prices of hamburger futures. Hamburger futures? Yes, there is a tiny but exciting market in America's favorite meat product.

title: Appel in Neglected Viola Music
description: TOBY APPEL explored some intriguingly offbeat musical by ways at his Alice Tully Hall recital Saturday afternoon. Mr. Appel's instrument is the viola, which he plays with the patrician instincts of a poet, and ins efforts to uncover neglected music for this relatively shy member of the string family almost always prove rewarding.

title: The Mets New Era
description: THE New York Mets will not be sold, Charles Shipman Payson, their owner, told the players the other day. That would be reassuring, except that they already have been. Since the team broke camp St. Petersburg last year, the club has disposed of Tom Seaver, Jon Matlack, Jerry Grote, Dave Kingman, John Milner and Felix Milian, not to mention Pepe Mangual, Mike Phillips, Roy Staiger and Joe Torre, who remains residence but no longer swings a bat.

title: Austrian Chief Denies Hitler Was Welcomed
description: VIENNA, March 12 (Reuters)President Rudolf Kirchschlager of Austria, marking the 40th anniversary of the Nazi occupation of Austria; today contested the idea that his countrymen overwhelmingly welc'med Hitler's invasion.

title: In the Zone
description: The point that winter 30 years ago was plainly just to get out of New York; and since an older brother of an affable boy I'd known In college owned Panama's leading bilingual newspaper, it seemed only logic to launch my international news career there with Tony's note recommending me, and the not another classmate whose father had been a President of Panamait was that kind of a college wrote to friends, and to be welcomed by three or four of them in white dinner jackets fresh from party the night I stepped off the plane.

title: Midwest Mayor, At 33, Rules Out A Fourth Term
description: MADISON, Wis.Paul R. Soglin surprised many people in this state capital when he successfully ran for Mayor five years ago at the age of 28. Now he has surprised them again by announcing that he has had enough and will not seek reelection for a fourth term.

title: Lopez Triumphs By Stroke
description: LOS ANGELES, March 12 (AP)Nancy Lopez shot a one-under-par 71 today and moved ahead of Debbie Austin to score her second straight Ladies Professional Gclf Association victory, by one stroke in the $100,000 Sunstar tournament.

title: Carol Spielman, Researcher, Bride of Joel Eugene Ewan
description: Carol Ray Spielman, daughter of Mrs. Donald Spielman of East Orange, N.J., and the late Mr. Spielman, was married yesterday to Joel Eugene Ewan, son of Mrs. Paul Ewan of San Diego and the late Mr. Ewan. The cere- mony was pertormed ny June Lea Yanoff of the Essex County Court at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J.

title: Advertising
description: Faced wtih growing public hositility toward its membership, the American Federation of State, County and Mu- nicial Employees will this week launch a SI rarllion image advertising effort with the help of the Washington office of the J. Walter Thompson Com- pany.

title: Newcomers Take Their Roles In City Opera's La Fanciulla
description: THE Saturday afternoon performance of Puccini's La FanciulIa del West at the New York State Theater offered one debut with the New York City Opera and three performers singing their roles with the company for the first time. But thanks to their efforts, the effective Frank Corsaro production and Christopher Keene'\s idiomatic, impas sioned conducting, the afternoon passed with a good deal of coherence and style.

title: Nation's Resistance To Busing Softens, But Rate Is Slowed
description: WASHINGTON, March 12At a school busing protest in Tampa, Fla., fewer than 10 spectators showed up. At a long meeting on educational policy in Louisville, the word busing was never mentioned. In Boston, the last policemen have been removed from the city schools. And in Jackson, Miss., the number of white first graders in public schools increased for the first time since busing started seven years ago.

title: Israel Imposes a Curfew on Metropolitan Corridor; Then Lifts It as Last 3 Terrorists Are Found Dead
description: HERZLIYA, Israel, March 12A major par' of Israel's densely populated metropolitan corridor was placed under the country's first curfew for Jews today as the toll of Israelis killed in the bloody terrorist attack on a tour bus yesterday reached 37. The curfew was lifted late tonight when the bodies of three missing Arab attackers were found, and the search abated.

title: LEFTISTS IN FRANCE GIVEN SLIM MAJORITY IN FIRSTROUND VOTE
description: PARIS, Monday, March 13The leftist opposition won a bare majority in yesterday's French legislative elections, according to projections based on incomplete but widespread returns. But the oppo- sition parties lead over the conservative Government coalition was too narrow to support their earlier confident predictions of victory in the final round of voting next Sunday.

title: Some U.S. Agencies Called Slow Payers
description: WASHINGTON, March 12 (UPI)The General Accounting Office said yesterday that it had looked into the complaints about the Government's being a slow payer and found it was true some of the time. Federal agencies are paying most of their bills on time, it said, but lengthy delays do occur.

title: Richerme, Pianist, Makes Recital Debut
description: CLAUDIO RICHERME'S full gifts as a pianist of more than ordinary talents were not fully in evidence until the second half of his New York debut concert in Carnegie Recital Hall late Saturday afternoon. The period before intermis- sion had been devoted entirely to Brahms's lengthy Sonata in F minor (Op. 5), an elusive piece even under the best circumstances.

title: The Lonely 950 Million
description: We can only wonder what it is like to be living China'these days. The Government is closing the books on the feverous doctrines of the Cultural Revolution and young women respond by unbraiding their hair, indeed by curling it.

title: The Wages of Terror
description: BOSTON, March 12After the deaths, the fear, the heartsickness, terror does its ultimate damage: to the hope of peace. That will almost certainly be true of the savagery just carlied out by Palestinian terrorists in Jsrael. For the attack was shrewdly, cn:elly timed to disrupt a crucial moment in the search for peace in the Middle East.

title: Pressure Mounts in Albany as Vote On Broad Death Penalty Bill Nears
description: ALBANY, March 12With many of its members facing what they say will be the most difficult vote of their careers, the Legislature is scheduled to act early this week on a sweeping capital-punishment bill that would permit executions for those convicted of intentional murders.

title: Bonnie Guidry, Singer, Bride of Tonathan Mann. Musician
description: Bonnie Carrie Guidry, daughter or the late Mr. and Mrs. Clifford James Guidry of Addis. La.. was married yesterday at the Windows on the World to Jonathan Mann, son of Seymour Mann and Mrs. Barry Brook. both of New York. Khoren Arisian, a leader of the Ethical Culture Sociaty, performed the ceremony.

description: his most groundbreaking effort, is also more conventional than much of his beat work has been. For the first time, he has deported from the comic ambiguity that has thus far been so essential to his style.

title: Television
Lou Reed Appears At Bottom Line
description: LOU REED was at the Bottom Line this weekend, part of a promotional tour to support his new record. Mr. Reed's creden- tials are unshakeable, ass leader of the old Velvet Underground and as inspira- tion for most of the movements that have taken place in underground New York rock-and-roll since the late 1960's.

title: Women's Track At the Garden
description: When the Women's Games started four years ago, fans could attend the finals, at Madison Square Garden, for free. At today's finals, they will have to pay. We have to charge admis- sion so that people will actually show up, explains a spokesman for the sponsor, Colgate. Last year groups would reserve a block of 50 seats but would not use them. Because those seats were taken, we couldn't let in kids, thinking there were no seats left. Still, admission to this track event is a bargain: 50 cents for everyone above the age of 19, 25 cents for youths. Competition begins at 4 P.M. The field was open to every woman in the five boroughs and in Jersey City, where Colgate has a plant.

title: Census Doubts Middle Incomes Are Squeezed by Costs of College
description: A report by the Bureau of the Census has challenged the contention that the Federal Government should reorient its programs of college aid so as to provide more help for the children of middle-income families.

title: Good Day for Mets
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 12One ball game does not a season make, but'there wasn't too much wrong with the ball game played today by the rebuilding New York Mets. They defeated the St. Louis Cardinals. 40, for their first victory of the exhibition season with Steve Henderscn knocking in three runs with a single, double and home run.

title: New Man in New York City's Health Maze
description: New York City spends $1 billion a year to operate municipal hospital conglomerate that some people believe it has no business running at all. This bewildering sys- tern is supervised by an equally bewildering array Federal, state, local and neighborhoodbased agencies. Into this maze now steps Axel Schupf, Mayor Koch's new Health Services Administrator (also chairman the Health and Hospitals Corporation board, and sundry other titles). His charge: to cut costs and improve services.

title: Music: Barbara Mallow, Cellist
description: ARBARA STEIN MALLOW, who performed Saturday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall, impressed as a cellist with temperament and imagination to spare. Not all her playing was fastidiousthe tone was sometimes frayed, and there were some amorphous. phrasings. But Miss Mallow's left hand is agile, her intonation is reliable and she immerses herself in the music with an unaffected conviction that discourages complaint.

title: Tennis: U.S. Completes Rout
description: NEW HAVEN, March 12Has the World Cup tennis rivalry between the United States and Australia become too onesided to sustain its spectator appeal?

title: Major Rebuilding of City Property Asked by New York Planning Unit
description: The New York City Planning Commis- sion called yesterday for a major pro- gram to rehabilitate decaying bridges, to repave wornout streets, to replace old water mains and to renew other property vital to the functioning of the city.

title: Bulgakov's Moliere, Drama About Power
description: M OLIERE in Spite of Himself, a translation and adaptation of a play by Mikhail Bulgakov, is brilliantly theatrical study of power. In its American premiere at the Colonnades Theater Lab, it has been given a superb, magical production.

title: GOTBAUM STRESSES REASONABLE TALKS
description: Head of MunicipalUnion Coalition Criticizes P.B.A. StandCites Study of City Underspending

title: New Community Board 11 Chosen To End Stalemate in East Harlem
description: Borough President Andrew J. Stein of Manhattan said last night that striferidden Community Board 11 in East Harlem, unable to organize since last year because of bickering factions, had been reestablished.

title: Amish Outbid Developers to Save Their Farmlands
description: LANCASTER, Pa., March 12 (AP)The Amish are digging their calloused hands into the pockets of their plain black trousers for the money to preserve 11 the culture of the Old Order in Lancaster County.

title: Gondrezick Out With Broken Nose
description: Glen Gondrezicic, the hustling Krick rookie, will be sidelined for two weeks with a fractured nose.
